synopsis.p: Applies action expressions on selected elements.

description.p: evaluates as a list of elements, then it evaluates on each element.

is useful when is a side-effect expression. The side-effect expressions allowed are controlled by: , , , , , , and . If these parameters are not set to true then will refuse to evaluate the corresponding side-effect expressions.

param-doc.name: target
param-doc.p: Elements on which to perform the action. The expression is evaluated as a list of elements with the corpus as the context element.

param-doc.name: active
param-doc.p: only runs if this expression evaluates to true.

param-doc.name: constantAnnotationFeatures
param-doc.p: Constant features to add to each annotation created by this module

param-doc.name: constantDocumentFeatures
param-doc.p: Constant features to add to each document created by this module

param-doc.name: constantRelationFeatures
param-doc.p: Constant features to add to each relation created by this module

param-doc.name: constantSectionFeatures
param-doc.p: Constant features to add to each section created by this module

param-doc.name: constantTupleFeatures
param-doc.p: Constant features to add to each tuple created by this module

param-doc.name: action
param-doc.p: Action to perform on each result of .

param-doc.name: addToLayer
param-doc.p: Allow to add annotations to layers.

param-doc.name: removeFromLayer
param-doc.p: Allow to remove annotations from layers.

param-doc.name: userFunctions
param-doc.p: Set user functions available for this module. If this module is a sequence, then all compounds inherit its functions.
